channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Stephen Curry on Tuesday set a new NBA career record for 3-pointers, surpassing Ray Allen, who finished his career with 2,973 made 3-pointers and held the record for 10 years. https://t.co/E2vT3bRdBe https://t.co/TgbI3NG2qr

At least two drugmakers want to ask the FDA to switch their birth-control pills from prescription to over-the-counter, but after more than five years of prolonged trial processes and dialogue, they still haven't yet been able to apply. https://t.co/Oka9i2S3TR https://t.co/nBAWiWjjRU

Pfizer announced that its Covid pill helped stave off severe disease in lab studies against the Omicron variant, which is surging in South Africa and Europe and is expected to dominate U.S. cases in the weeks ahead. https://t.co/7cVhOd6Ueq https://t.co/8DWqXeyhmf
Breaking News: Stephen Curry made his 2,974th 3-pointer, breaking the NBA career record held by Ray Allen. https://t.co/g4nH81bql7

Cornell University moved finals exams to an online format, closed libraries and gyms, barred visitors from campus and took other restrictive measures after the school’s Covid testing lab found evidence of the Omicron variant in a number of students’ tests. https://t.co/sgKmhbwULN

Keechant Sewell, the Nassau County chief of detectives, will become New York City's first female police commissioner. Her appointment was seen as one of the most important decisions for Eric Adams, the incoming mayor, as he fills out his administration. https://t.co/geRlhpYUlN https://t.co/zUZuI4wZti

The HPV vaccine, which only works when administered before people become infected by the virus, can prevent as many as 90% of six potentially lethal cancers. Yet, it's being met with rising resistance from parents. https://t.co/C3QHMOwqhz
Breaking News: Keechant Sewell will be the first woman to lead the New York Police Department, taking over the largest police force in the U.S. at a key moment. https://t.co/bB4SQbWY8r

The posthumous brain examination of Phillip Adams, a retired NFL player who shot and killed six people in April before fatally shooting himself, revealed that he had an "unusually severe" form of CTE, a brain disease linked with repeated hits to the head. https://t.co/S2zJpLejcG

The Jan. 6 panel recommended on Monday that Mark Meadows, the last White House chief of staff for Donald Trump, be charged with criminal contempt of Congress for defying its subpoena. The House was poised to do the same on Tuesday. https://t.co/EKglg5Ri9A https://t.co/qQbn3XY9t2

Joshua Bellamy, a former New York Jets player who fraudulently obtained more than $1.2 million in Covid relief money and spent tens of thousands of dollars of it on luxury items, has been sentenced to about three years in prison. https://t.co/hcfaMvme3s
New prescription eye drops can help users see up close without affecting their long-range vision — and may mean they can ditch their reading glasses for a few hours. https://t.co/w5B2HkjOe7

With the future of Roe v. Wade in the hands of the Supreme Court, we took a look at the current state of abortion in America. The abortion rate has fallen in recent decades, but the procedure is still common. Here’s what the typical patient looks like. https://t.co/KsFbQpJFoY https://t.co/VOVMm5rNtk

Breaking News: Former Gov. Andrew Cuomo was ordered to turn over about $5.1 million in proceeds from his 2020 pandemic memoir to the state attorney general by a New York ethics board. https://t.co/9AuW3jf3oI

"It just seems insulting and absurd to have teachers doing an event like this to raise a few hundred dollars for their classrooms," a South Dakota state senator said. "What other profession would be asked to fund-raise this way?" https://t.co/cq3BFlvxGl
Philadelphia will require proof of vaccination to eat or drink indoors starting Jan. 3, city officials announced on Monday. Covid cases have been rising rapidly in the city. https://t.co/Io8mCxSNoJ

“The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring” is among the 25 movies selected for preservation on the Library of Congress’s National Film Registry.
“Return of the Jedi,” “Selena,” “Wall-E” and “A Nightmare on Elm Street” also made this year’s list. https://t.co/xxVziet32y

Vicente Fernández, the ranchera singer who died on Sunday, may be emblematic of a type of dated machismo, but for many, he was the ideal of what it means to be hard-working, hard-loving Mexican man. https://t.co/ySSauNkn9o https://t.co/bMXQAlZw6a

Masayuki Uemura, who developed the Nintendo Entertainment System, which helped start a global revolution in home gaming and laid the foundation for today’s video game industry, died on Dec. 9. He was 78. https://t.co/2JlWyuwkpe

Denmark's former immigration minister, Inger Stojberg, was sentenced to two months in prison after being found guilty of illegally ordering the separation of underage couples seeking asylum. https://t.co/apQGwuOCdD
Breaking News: Pfizer said trials of its Covid pill confirmed that it helped stave off severe disease. A lab study found it worked against Omicron. https://t.co/QypDRIuHAo

Black women are more likely than white women to develop uterine fibroids, noncancerous tumors that grow in the uterus. The symptoms often make them feel fearful and alone.
“I felt like no one truly listened,” said one woman who was at first misdiagnosed. https://t.co/NtVLEFnpzg
Breaking News: The Supreme Court refused to block New York's vaccine mandate for health care workers, which allows medical, but not religious, exemptions. https://t.co/7jpYulRyfa

"It just seems insulting and absurd to have teachers doing an event like this to raise a few hundred dollars for their classrooms," a South Dakota state senator said. "What other profession would be asked to fund-raise this way?" https://t.co/tmNDP8CpLq
Breaking News: The Jan. 6 panel recommended that Mark Meadows, the former White House chief of staff, be charged with criminal contempt of Congress. https://t.co/dEHcdsMdey

Breaking News: No U.S. troops will be punished for the botched strike in Afghanistan that killed 10 civilians, including children, a Pentagon official said. The military initially defended the strike but ultimately called it a tragic mistake. https://t.co/UIdrjeiFgu https://t.co/DKRSsVx5o2

Breaking News: California is reinstating a statewide indoor mask mandate, as the Omicron variant rapidly spreads and Covid cases rise. The mandate will go into effect on Wednesday and will remain until at least Jan. 15, state officials said on Monday. https://t.co/8FRzHNpilf

The Supreme Court on Monday refused to block New York's statewide requirement that health care workers be vaccinated against the coronavirus even when they cite religious objections. https://t.co/gkwEK7tkFK https://t.co/XPV2qFOdTz
Philadelphia will require proof of vaccination to eat or drink indoors starting Jan. 3, city officials announced on Monday. Covid cases have been rising rapidly in the city. https://t.co/t2fFsPa24w

Breaking News: Hundreds of gymnasts who were abused by former national team doctor Larry Nassar reached a $380 million settlement with U.S. gymnastics and Olympics organizations. The settlement is among the largest ever for a sexual abuse case. https://t.co/QxId7iYIOs

Galvanized by Donald Trump’s 2020 election lies, a new class of political activists have begun seeking offices supervising the election systems that they believe robbed Trump of a second term. https://t.co/kwHV7XdU1b

In Opinion
Cities blanketed in dust. Graveyards swallowed by the sea. For years, scientists have sounded the alarm. Now it’s here.
This is “Postcards From a World on Fire,” a look at climate change in 193 countries. https://t.co/atGmk2ax7G https://t.co/0qlWF9sNRg

Thea-Mai Baumann's Instagram handle was @metaverse. “You are now a millionaire,” one person messaged her when Facebook announced it was changing its name. "Fb isn’t gonna buy it, they’re gonna take it,” said another.
And that's exactly what happened. https://t.co/Zk7Petbkk4

The House committee investigating the attack on the Capitol laid out its case for a contempt of Congress charge against Mark Meadows, former President Trump's chief of staff, showing evidence of his deep involvement in the effort to overturn the election. https://t.co/VXUDsMnoJw

Thea-Mai Baumann's Instagram handle was @metaverse. “You are now a millionaire,” one person messaged her when Facebook announced it was changing its name. "Fb isn’t gonna buy it, they’re gonna take it,” said another.
And that's exactly what happened. https://t.co/FJ8fEF2qFI https://t.co/xjp3bLzphl

A thoughtfully chosen housewarming gift can help a new house become a home. @wirecutter found more than two dozen gifts that are useful and imaginative. https://t.co/lQHe9AOIAi https://t.co/eXexN2p66n

Rare footage — which includes scenes of police officers directing traffic and horse-drawn carts piled high with wicker lobster pots — shows life in Ireland in the early years of its independence from Britain. https://t.co/INrg65xwjy

Vicente Fernández, known as “El Rey,” the king of traditional ranchera music, has died at 81. Fernández was known for his operatic range and marathon performances, delivered in a signature charro outfit and intricately embroidered sombrero. https://t.co/besuECr6Yl

Anne Rice’s novels resonated not only with fans of gothic romance, but with readers who found a spiritual element in them or those who identified with their themes of isolation and alienation. She died on Saturday at 80. https://t.co/bXuUY4afAY

Insufficient sleep can have widespread damaging effects on physical and mental health, including increased risk of developing heart disease, high blood pressure, stroke and Type 2 diabetes, a growing body of evidence suggests. https://t.co/gMgY0ZK3oE
In the months before his assassination, President Jovenel Moïse of Haiti was about to destroy crime syndicates and name names. https://t.co/Qzt18fsfcQ
CNN announced that Chris Wallace would have an interview program on its new streaming service after Mr. Wallace said he was leaving Fox News after 18 years with the network. https://t.co/M6JFwK0YtM
Breaking News: The “Fox News Sunday” host Chris Wallace said that he would leave Fox News after 18 years at the network. https://t.co/uO04dXcuLz

A top secret U.S. strike cell known as Talon Anvil played an outsized role in the air war against ISIS. But in the rush to destroy enemies, it ignored military safeguards and repeatedly killed civilians, according to current and former officials. https://t.co/xa2LhfKmNV
Officials said that there were “confirmed fatalities” after a roof collapsed at an Amazon warehouse in Illinois, leaving workers trapped. https://t.co/NknfF9rS37 https://t.co/IhbmlT3ytF

Max Verstappen, the Dutch racecar driver who won the Formula 1 championship, said in October, “I know that if my car is fast enough until the end of the season, I will win the championship, but if it’s not, then we probably won’t win it.” https://t.co/oWexlPQcAs

Late Saturday night, Gov. Gavin Newsom of California accused Texas of insulating its abortion law from the courts, and then called on lawmakers to use a similar strategy to go after the gun industry. https://t.co/j9CFqAWY9v
The prolific writer Anne Rice has died at 80. The Gothic novelist was famous for “Interview With the Vampire,” which was made into a hit movie. https://t.co/SvqnWLnL27

A Texas law constricts teachers when it comes to race and history. Now the fierce battle over what can be taught has become something broader, an effort to curtail and even ban books, including classics of American literature. https://t.co/NVjPkGnCLc

Insufficient sleep can have widespread damaging effects on physical and mental health, including increased risk of developing heart disease, high blood pressure, stroke and Type 2 diabetes, a growing body of evidence suggests. https://t.co/TngMpvgj9w
